page.title: 06St.Luke's Church-Kinoulton
page.content: The church was built in{1793}and is 192 years old. The squire in the 1790's was{Henry Nevile, Earl of {Gainsborough.}He decided that the present church, St. Wilfrid's, was too far away from the village. So he built {St.Luke's Church}near the canal with bricks from the brickyard. According to local history, grave stones were used by the village baker to line his ovens. This misdemeanour was exposed when a customer noticed that there was an imprint in the bread saying{IN LOVING MEMORY.} We have just had a new set of {bells}in the tower. They are small and so quiet that microphones have been installed to make them louder. The present vicar is the{Reverend {Peter Harrison.
